description: Perhaps from a Flemish dialect of Dutch windtelen (“to reel”); compare wentelen.

verbs.description: wintle (third-person singular simple present wintles, present participle wintling, simple past and past participle wintled)

examples: The worm of hell, which never dies, / In wintled coil writhes up and fries.

entries.meaning: (Scotland) To stagger, to sway or rock.

examples: At a quick turn o' the road they wintled owre, and there they were, sitting on their doups in the atoms o' the gig, and glowering frae them!
Miss Radford wintled across the floor on her bottom until she slumped beside Eloise, who rolled her eyes and bared her lower teeth.
